com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector.Vector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable

    public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stringable
    A Vector stores an array of double-precision floating point values. The meta-data for each element are defined by a VectorMetadata (which may be shared among many Vectors). Although the values are stored as doubles, the meta-data specifies whether an element is intended to represent a floating-point or integer value. The magnitude of the maximum value that may be stored is 2^53, see maximumIntegerValue. Attempts to store values larger than this in elements intended to store integer values results in an IllegalArgumentException.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • maximumIntegerValue

        public final double maximumIntegerValue
        The largest magnitude (positive or negative) integer that may be stored in a Vector. This is determined by the largest integer value for which it and all smaller integer values can be accurately represented by a (IEEE 754) double. The value is 2^53 (between an int (2^31) and long (2^63)).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EMPTY

        public static final Vector EMPTY
        An empty (zero length/size) vector.

      • metadata

        public final VectorMetadata metadata
        Information about each element of the vector.

      • mutable

        public final boolean mutable
        Whether the values in this Vector may be modified (via set(int, double).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vector

        public Vector(Vector vector)
        Copy constructor. The values of the new Vector are independent from the given vector but the metadata is copied by reference.

      • Vector

        public Vector(VectorMetadata info,
      double[] values,
      boolean mutable)
        Create a Vector with the specified meta data and values.
        Parameters:
        info - The information about each element of the vector.
        values - The values of the vector. These will be copied into a new array.
        mutable - Whether the values may be modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the meta data does not contain the same number of elements as that for the values or if a value in the given array for an element intended to store an integer has magnitude greater than maximumIntegerValue.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the values in this vector are not mutable.

      • Vector

        public Vector(VectorMetadata info)
        Create a Vector with the specified meta data and values initialised to zero. The Vector will be mutable.
        Parameters:
        info - The information about each element of the vector.

      • Vector

        public Vector(VectorMetadata info,
      boolean mutable,
      java.util.Random random)
        Create a Vector with the specified meta data and with random values distributed uniformly between their minimum and maximum values (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        info - The information about each element of the vector.
        mutable - Whether the values may be modified.
        random - The RNG to use to generate the values.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the length of this vector.

      • get

        public double get(int index)
        Get the value at the specified index. If the element at the specified index is intended to hold an integer value then it may be safely cast to a long without losing precision.

      • getInt

        public int getInt(int index)
        Get the value at the specified index cast as an int.

      • getLong

        public long getLong(int index)
        Get the value at the specified index cast as a long.

      • set

        public void set(int index,
       double value)
        Set the value at the specified index. If the element at the given index is intended to store an integer then the given value will be rounded. If the value is outside of the bounds specified by the metadata then it will be clamped to the lower or upper bound as necessary.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the values are not mutable or if the value at the specified index is intended to store an integer and a value with magnitude greater than maximumIntegerValue was given.

      • setValues

        public void setValues(Vector vector)
        Copy the values from the given vector to this vector. For any elements intended to store integers, the corresponding values from the given vector will be rounded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector whose values should be copied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the values in this vector are not mutable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given vector does not contain the same number of elements as this vector or if a value in the given vector for an element intended to store an integer has magnitude greater than maximumIntegerValue.

      • setValues

        public void setValues(double[] newValues)
        Copy the values from the given array to this vector. For any elements intended to store integers, the corresponding values from the given array will be rounded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        newValues - the array whose values should be copied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the values in this vector are not mutable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given array does not contain the same number of elements as this vector or if a value in the given array for an element intended to store an integer has magnitude greater than maximumIntegerValue.

      • getValues

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getValues()
        Get a List view of the values (the values as an unmodifiable list backed by the underlying primitive array).

      • getValuesReference

        public double[] getValuesReference()
        Get a reference to the underlying values array. Be careful. Do not modify the values if mutable is not set.

      • copy

        public Vector copy()
        Creates and returns a copy of this Vector, the values in the new Vector are independent of the values in this vector but the metadata (which is immutable) is copied by reference.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Two Vectors are considered equal if they have the same VectorMetadata specifications and the same values.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

        public int hashCode()
        Hash code based on the values.

        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • sum

        public double sum()
        Returns a raw sum over all the values in this vector.

      • calculateAverage

        public static Vector calculateAverage(java.util.Collection<Vector> vectors)
        Returns a new Vector whose values are the averages of the corresponding values over the given Vectors.
        Parameters:
        vectors - the Vectors to average over.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the list of vectors is empty.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the given Vectors have different metadata.

      • getStringableMap

        public void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object). When overriding this method in a sub-class the super-class implementation should usually be called from the overriding implementation.
        Specified by:
        getStringableMap in interface Stringable
        Parameters:
        map - Mapping from descriptive labels to Objects that can be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).
